That's a great approach! Focusing on the script will help you craft a clear, concise, and engaging narrative for your video. By highlighting the lessons you learned from your favorite books and how they've helped you professionally, you'll be able to showcase your expertise and provide value to your audience.

Sharing the video on LinkedIn is an excellent idea, too! You can upload the video directly to LinkedIn or share a link to your YouTube video. This will help you reach a broader audience, including professionals who might not be active on YouTube.

Remember to:

1. **Optimize your video title, description, and tags**: Use relevant keywords, such as "professional development," "book recommendations," "leadership lessons," or "career growth," to help your video appear in search results.
2. **Use attention-grabbing thumbnails**: Create an eye-catching thumbnail that showcases the topic of your video and grabs the viewer's attention.
3. **Promote your video**: Share your video on your LinkedIn feed, LinkedIn groups, and other relevant online communities to increase visibility.
4. **Engage with your audience**: Respond to comments and questions on both YouTube and LinkedIn to foster a discussion and build relationships with your audience.

By following these tips, you'll be able to create a high-quality video that resonates with your audience and helps you establish yourself as a thought leader in your industry.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Good luck with your video, and I hope it helps you achieve your goals!
